NEJM Catalyst Innovations in Care Delivery will begin publishing monthly in 2021!

Visit our author center to share your manuscript submissions: https://t.co/B1r2ZQmItW
text.1: The CDC strongly recommends that people not travel for #Thanksgiving to limit the spread of #COVID19, agency officials said in a Thursday briefing. Roughly 1 million new cases have been diagnosed in the U.S. in the past week.
text.2: #AHA20: The RIVER trial supports use of rivaroxaban as a safe, effective alternative to warfarin in patients with bioprosthetic mitral valves. Read comment by @FaRodriguezMD on @NEJM study: https://t.co/W187qN3pQV https://t.co/GrGXUnthto
text.3: For a medical student who discovers the cadaver she used in the anatomy lab was an unclaimed body, the class was a first lesson in the uncomfortable truth that people with less power and fewer advocates can be vulnerable to exploitation by the medical profession.
text.4: Endometrial carcinoma is diagnosed in about 58,500 women in the United States per year. It is linked with obesity, excess estrogen, and the Lynch syndrome. Oral contraceptives lower the risk by 30 to 40%. Most patients undergo surgery with or without radiation therapy.
text.5: In an analysis of a 296-patient trial with ALK-positive non–small-cell lung cancer, lorlatinib was superior to crizotinib in response, 12-month progression-free survival, & intracranial disease response. Altered lipid levels were the major toxic effect associated with lorlatinib.
text.6: In August 2020, the FDA missed a statutory deadline to release rules governing over-the-counter hearing aids. It’s unclear when the agency will fulfill its legal obligation to establish regulations that are expected to increase treatment access for millions of people.
